description: Hearty, flavorful, and protein-packed patties made from mashed beans, vegetables, and aromatic spices. They are pan-fried until golden brown and crispy on the outside, making a delicious and satisfying vegetarian burger or main course.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: While beans are a traditional staple in Uganda, forming them into burger patties is a modern, health-conscious adaptation. This recipe reflects a growing interest in plant-based eating and creative ways to enjoy local ingredients. It's a popular choice for families looking for meat-free options and fits well into the global trend of vegetarian cuisine while using familiar Ugandan flavors.

ingredients.name: Cooked Beans
ingredients.notes: Red kidney beans or black-eyed peas, mashed

ingredients.name: Egg
ingredients.notes: Beaten (can use flax egg for vegan)

steps.instruction: If using canned beans, drain and rinse them thoroughly. Place the cooked beans in a large mixing bowl and mash them with a potato masher or fork until mostly smooth but with some texture remaining.
Add the finely chopped onion, minced garlic, diced bell pepper, breadcrumbs/oats, beaten egg, chopped herbs, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the mashed beans.

Mix everything together until well combined. The mixture should be firm enough to hold its shape when formed into a patty. If it's too wet, add a little more breadcrumbs. If it's too dry, add a teaspoon of water or oil.
Divide the mixture into 6-8 equal portions. With damp hands, shape each portion into a round, flat patty about 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick.
Place the flour on a plate. Lightly coat each patty in flour, shaking off the excess. This helps create a nice crust when frying.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Carefully place the patties in the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan; cook in batches if necessary. Fry for 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy.

cooking_indicators.visual: Deep golden brown and firm to the touch.
cooking_indicators.texture: Crispy exterior, firm and hot inside.

steps.instruction: Remove the patties from the skillet and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
Serve the bean burger patties hot.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a classic burger in a bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, and your favorite sauce (e.g., ketchup, mayo, or chili sauce). They are also excellent on their own with a side of mashed potatoes, rice, or a fresh salad.
